1.wird:
بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَنِ الرَّحِيمِ
قُلْ هُوَ اللهُ أَحَدٌ ، اللّهُ الصَّمَدُ، لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُولَدْ ، وَلَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌ (3)
1.english: 1. Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “He is Allah—One ˹and Indivisible˺; 2. Allah—the Sustainer ˹needed by all˺. 3. He has never had offspring, nor was He born. 4. And there is none comparable to Him.”
1.transliteration:
Bismillāhi'r Rahmāni'r Rahīm
Qul Huwallāhu Ahad
Allāhu's Samad
lam yalid
wa lam yūlad
wa lam yakun lahū kufuwan ahad (3)

2.wird:
بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَنِ الرَّحِيمِ
قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ الْفَلَقِ، مِنْ شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ، وَمِنْ شَرِّ غَاسِقٍ إِذَا وَقَبَ، وَمِنْ شَرِّ النَّفَّاثَاتِ فِي الْعُقَدِ، وَمِنْ شَرِّ حَاسِدٍ إِذَا حَسَدَ (3)
2.english: 1. Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I seek refuge in the Lord of the daybreak 2. from the evil of whatever He has created, 3. and from the evil of the night when it grows dark, 4. and from the evil of those ˹witches casting spells by˺ blowing onto knots, 5. and from the evil of an envier when they envy.”
2.transliteration:
Bismillāhi'r Rahmāni'r Rahīm
Qul a‘ūdhu bi-Rabbi’l-falaq
min sharri mā khalaq
wa min sharri ghāsiqin idhā waqab
wa min sharri’n-naffāthāti fi’l-‘uqad
wa min sharri hāsidin idhā hasad (3)

3.wird:
بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَنِ الرَّحِيمِ
قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ النَّاسِ، مَلِكِ النَّاسِ إِلَهِ النَّاسِ، مِنْ شَرِّ الْوَسْوَاسِ الْخَنَّاسِ الَّذِي يُوَسْوِسُ فِي صُدُورِ النَّاسِ، مِنَ الْجِنَّةِ وَالنَّاسِ (3)
3.english: 1. Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I seek refuge in the Lord of humankind, 2. the Master of humankind, 3. the God of humankind, 4. from the evil of the lurking whisperer— 5. who whispers into the hearts of humankind— 6. from among jinn and humankind.”
3.transliteration:
Bismillāhi’r Rahmāni’r Rahīm
A‘ūdhu bi-Rabbi’n nās Maliki’n nās Ilāhi’n nās min sharri’l waswāsi’l khannās alladhī yuwaswisu fī sudūri’n nās min al-jinnati wa’n nās (3)

4.wird: رَبِّ أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ هَمَزَاتِ الشَّيَاطِينِ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ رَبِّ أَنْ يَحْضُرُونِ (3)
4.english: O my Lord, I seek Your protection from the temptations and whispers of the devilsAnd I seek Your protection from their evil presence
4.transliteration: Rabbi a‘ūdhu bika min hamazāti’sh-shayātīn wa a‘ūdhu bika Rabbi an yahdurūn (3)

5.wird: أَفَحَسِبْتُم أَنَّمَا خَلَقْنَاكُمْ عَبَثًا وَأَنَّكُمْ إِلَيْنَا لَا تُرْجَعُونَ، فَتَعَالَى اللَّهُ المَلِكُ الحَقُّ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا هُوَ رَبُّ العَرْشِ الكَرِيمِ، وَمَن يَدْعُ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَهَا آخَرَ لَا بُرْهَانَ لَهُ بِهِ فَإِنَّمَا حِسَابُهُ عِندَ رَبِّهِ إِنَّهُ لَا يُفْلِحُ الْكَافِرُونَ، وَقُلْ رَبِّ اغْفِرْ وَارْحَمْ وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ الرَّاحِمِينَ
5.english: Could you really have thought that We created you without a meaning, without purpose, and that you would not return to Us at the end? Allah, the King of Truth, is Exalted far above that. There is no ultimate goal, no deity, but Him, the Master of the entire cosmos. Let the one who pursues an illusionary god alongside the True God know that he will have to face his Caretaker and Creator in the end. Those who turn their backs to God will never be happy. Say, then, “O my Lord! Forgive and show Your Unconditional Love and Acceptance, for it is You Who Loves truly and unconditionally, more than a mother loves her child.”
5.transliteration: Afa-hasibtum annamā khalaqnākum ‘abathan wa annakum ilaynā lā turja‘ūn Fa-Ta‘ālallāhu’l Maliku’l Haqq lā ilāha illā Huwa Rabbu’l ‘Arshi’l Karīm Wa man yad‘u ma‘Allāhi ilāhan ākhara lā burhāna lahū bihī fa innamā hisābuhū ‘inda Rabbihī innahū lā yuflihu’l kāfirūn Wa qul Rabbi’ghfir wa’rham wa Anta Khayru’r Rāhimīn

6.wird: فسبحانَ اللهِ حِينَ تُمْسُونَ وَحِينَ تُصْبِحُونَ، وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ فِي السَّمَواتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَعَشِيَّا وَحِينَ تُظْهِرُونَ، يُخْرِجُ الْحَيَّ مِنَ الْمَيِّتِ وَيُخْرِجُ المَيِّتَ مِنَ الحَيِّ ويُحْيِي الأَرْضَ بَعْدَ مَوْتِهَا وَكَذَلِكَ تُخْرَجُونَ
6.english: Glory be to Allah the Exalted, when the day turns to evening, and when the night turns to day; to Him belongs all Praise - in the Heavens and upon Earth, and by night and at the brightest hour! He brings the dead to life! And He brings the living to their death! He revives the earth after its death. In this same way, you will be brought from the current stage you are in, to the next.
6.transliteration: Fa SubhānAllāhi hīna tumsūna wa hīna tusbihūn Wa lahu’l hamdu fi’s-samāwāti wa’l ardi wa ‘ashiyyan wa hīna tuzhirūn Yukhriju’l hayya min al-mayyiti wa yukhriju’l mayyita min al-hayy wa yuhyi’l arda ba‘da mawtihā wa kadhālika tukhrajūn

7.wird: أَعُوْذُ بِٱللّٰهِ ٱلسَّمِيعِ ٱلْعَلِيْمِ مِنَ ٱلشَّيْطَانِ ٱلرَّجِيمِ (3)
7.english: I seek refuge in God, Who hears all things, and knows all things, from the influence of Satan the one who chose to remain distant from God’s Grace.

8.wird: لَوْ أَنْزَلْنَا هَذَا الْقُرْآنَ عَلَى جَبَلٍ لَرَأَيْتَهُ خَاشِعًا مُتَصَدِّعًا مِنْ خَشْيَةِ اللَّهِ ۚ وَتِلْكَ الْأَمْثَالُ نَضْرِبُهَا لِلنَّاسِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ ۚ هُوَ اللَّهُ الَّذِي لَا إِلَاهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۖ عَالِمُ الْغَيْبِ وَالشَّهَادَةِ ۖ هُوَ الرَّحْمَنُ الرَّحِيمُ
8.english: Had We sent down this Qur’ān on a mountain, you would have certainly seen it humbling itself and splitting asunder for its fear of Allāh. We relate these parables to men so that they may reflect. He is Allāh; there is no god, but Him. The AllKnower of the Unseen and the seen. He is the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.
8.transliteration: Law anzalnā hādha’l Qur’āna ‘alā jabalin lara’aytahū khāshi‘an mutasaddi‘an min khashyatillāh wa tilka’l amthālu nadribuhā li’nnāsi la‘allahum yatafakkarūn huwa

9.wird: هُوَ اللَّـهُ الَّذِي لَا إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ الْمَلِكُ الْقُدُّوسُ السَّلَامُ الْمُؤْمِنُ الْمُهَيْمِنُ الْعَزِيزُ الْجَبَّارُ الْمُتَكَبِّرُ ۚ سُبْحَانَ اللَّـهِ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ ، هُوَ اللَّـهُ الْخَالِقُ الْبَارِئُ الْمُصَوِّرُ ۖ لَهُ الْأَسْمَاءُ الْحُسْنَىٰ ۚ يُسَبِّحُ لَهُ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ وَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ
9.english: He is Allāh; there is no god, but Him; the King, the Most Pure, the Source of Peace (Perfection), the Giver of Security, the Protector, the All-Mighty, the Compeller, the Supremely Great; Glory be to Allāh. (High is He) above all that they associate as partners with Him. He is Allāh, the Creator, the Maker, the Fashioner. To Him belongs the Most Beautiful Names. Everything in the Heavens and the earth glorify Him. And He is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.
9.transliteration: Huwallāhulladhī lā ilāha illā Huwa ‘Ālimu’l ghaybi wa’sh-shahādati Huwa’r Rahmānu’r Rahīm Huwallāhulladhī lā ilāha illā Huwa’l Maliku’l Quddūsu’s Salāmu’l Mu’minu’l Muhayminu’l ‘Azīzu’l Jabbāru’l Mutakabbir SubhānAllāhi ‘amma yushrikūn Huwallāhu’l Khaliqu’l Bāriu’l Musawwiru lahu’l Asmā’ u’l Husnā yusabbihu lahū mā fi’s-samāwāti wa’l-ardi wa Huwa’l ‘Azīzu’l Hakīm

10.wird: سلامٌ على نُوحٍ في العالَمين، إنَّا كذلكَ نَجْزِي المُحْسِنِينَ، إنَّهُ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا المُؤْمِنِينَ
10.english: “Peace and salutations to Noah among the nations (man, jinn and all that exist)!” Verily, this is the way that We reward the righteous. For he was one of Our believing bondsmen.
10.transliteration: Salāmun ‘alā Nūhin fi’l ‘ālamīn Innā kadhālika najzi’l muhsinīn Innahū min ‘ibādina’l mu’minīn

11.wird: أَعُوذُ بِكَلِمَاتِ اللَّهِ التَّامَّاتِ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ (3)
11.english: I seek refuge in the Perfect Words of God from the evil He has created.
11.transliteration: A‘ūdhu bi-Kalimātillāhi’t-tāmmāti min sharri mā khalaq (3)

12.wird: بِسْمِ اللهِ الذِي لَا يَضُرُّ مَعَ اسْمِهِ شَيْءٌ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَا فِي السَّمَاءِ، وَهُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ (3)
12.english: In the Name of Allah, with Whose Name nothing on earth or in the heavens can cause harm, and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
12.transliteration: Bismillāhilladhī lā yadurru ma‘a Ismihī shay’un fi’l ardi wa lā fi’s-samā’i wa Huwa’s Samī‘u’l ‘Alīm (3)

13.wird: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَصْبَحْتُ مِنْكَ فِي نِعْمَةٍ وَعَافِيَةٍ وَسِتْرٍ، فَأَتِمَّ نِعْمَتَكَ عَلَيَّ وَعَافِيَتَكَ وَسِتْرَكَ فِي الدُّنْيَا وَالآخِرَةِ (3)
13.english: O Allāh! I find myself this morning with favours (bounties), good health and protection from You. So, O Allāh, complete Your favours, good health and Your protection for me in this world as well as in the Hereafter.
13.eveningwird: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَمْسَيْتُ مِنْكَ فِي نِعْمَةٍ وَعَافِيَةٍ وَسِتْرٍ، فَأَتِمَّ نِعْمَتَكَ عَلَيَّ وَعَافِيَتَكَ وَسِتْرَكَ فِي الدُّنْيَا وَالآخِرَةِ (3)
13.transliteration: Allāhumma innī asbahtu minka fī ni‘matin wa ‘āfiyatin wa sitrin fa atmim ni‘mataka ‘alayya wa ‘āfiyataka wa sitraka fi’d-dunyā wa’l ākhira (3)

14.wird: اللَّهُمَّ، إِنِّي أَصْبَحْتُ أُشْهِدُكَ وَأُشْهِدُ حَمَلَةَ عَرْشِكَ وَمَلائِكَتَكَ وَجَمِيعَ خَلْقِكَ، أَنَّكَ أَنْتَ اللهُ، لا إِلهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ، وَحْدَكَ لا شَرِيكَ لَكَ، وَأَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُكَ وَرَسُولُكَ (4)
14.english: O Allāh! This morning I take You, the carriers of Your Throne, Your Angels and all of creation as witnesses, that truly You are Allāh; there is no god, but You, You have no partners, and that truly, Muḥammad is Your bondsman and Messenger.
14.eveningwird: اللَّهُمَّ، إِنِّي أَمْسَيْتُ أُشْهِدُكَ وَأُشْهِدُ حَمَلَةَ عَرْشِكَ وَمَلائِكَتَكَ وَجَمِيعَ خَلْقِكَ، أَنَّكَ أَنْتَ اللهُ، لا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ، وَحْدَكَ لا شَرِيكَ لَكَ، وَأَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُكَ وَرَسُولُكَ (4)
14.transliteration: Allāhumma innī asbahtu ush’hiduka wa ush’hidu hamalata ‘arshika wa malāikataka wa jamī‘a khalqika annaka Antallāhu lā ilāha illā Anta Wahdaka lā sharīka laka wa anna Muhammad-an ‘Abduka wa Rasūluk (4)

15.wird: الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ، حَمْدًا يُوَافِي نِعَمَهُ وَيُكَافِئُ مَزِيدَهُ (3)
15.english: All Praise is only for Allāh, Lord of the Worlds; Praises that are equal to His Bounties and matches His added Grace and Bounties.
15.transliteration: Al-hamdu Lillāhi Rabbi’l ‘ālamīn hamdan yuwāfī ni‘amahū wa yukāfi’u mazīdah

16.wird: آمَنْتُ بِاللهِ الْعَظِيمِ، وَكَفَرْتُ بِالْجِبْتِ وَالطَّاغُوتِ، وَاِسْتَمْسَكْتُ بِالْعُرْوَةِ الْوُثْقَى لاَ انفِصَامَ لَهَا، وَاللهُ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ (3)
16.english: I believe in Allāh, the Great; and I reject all idols and false gods; and I grasp solidly the most trustworthy handhold that never breaks. And Allāh is All-Hearing, AllKnowing.
16.transliteration: Āmantu Billāhi’l ‘Azīm, wa kafartu bi’l jibti wat-tāghūti, wa’stamsaktu bi’l ‘urwati’l wuthqā lanfisāma lahā, Wallāhu Samī‘un ‘Alīm

17.wird: رَضِيتُ بِاللَّهِ رَبًّا، وَبِالْإِسْلامِ دِينًا، وَبِسَيِّدِنَا مُحَمَّدٍ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِهِ وَسَلَّمَ نَبِيًّا وَرَسُولًا (3)
17.english: I am contented and fulfilled to have God as my Caretaker,I am contented and fulfilled with submission to Him as my way of life,and I am contented and fulfilled to have our Prophet Muhammad .- may God continue to nourish his soul and our connection to him -be my Prophet and Guide!
17.transliteration: Radītu Billāhi Rabban, wa bi’l Islāmi dīnā, wa bi Sayyidinā Muhammad-in, Sallallāhu ‘alayhi wa sallama Nabiyyan wa Rasūlā

18.wird: حَسْبِيَ اللَّهُ، لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا هُوَ، عَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ، وَهُوَ رَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيمِ (7)
18.english: Allah the Exalted is Enough for me! He is looking after me completely. Only Allah is worthy of being sought. I let go of all pretenses to control and place my full reliance on Him! He is the Caretaker of this entire cosmos, the One Who keeps it all in perfect balance, the Maintainer of its intricacy and Sustainer of its immensity, and Controller of all action and every movement therein.
18.transliteration: Hasbiyallāhu lā ilāha illā Huwa ‘alayhi tawakkaltu wa Huwa Rabbu’l ‘Arshi’l ‘Azīm

19.wird: اللَّهُمَّ صَلِّ وَسَلِّمْ عَلَى سَيِّدِنَا مُحَمَّدٍ، وَعَلَى آلِهِ وَصَحْبِهِ، وَسَلِّمْ (10)
19.english: O Allāh! Send Blessings upon our master Muḥammad, his family and Companions, and bestow Peace upon them.
19.transliteration: Allāhumma salli ‘alā Sayyidinā Muhammad-in wa ālihī wa sahbihī wa sallim

20.wird: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ مِنْ فَجْأَةِ الْخَيْرِ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ فَجْأَةِ الشَّرِّ.
20.english: O Allah, I ask You for sudden good things to happen, and I seek Your protection from sudden bad things.
20.transliteration: Allāhumma innī as’aluka min fujā’ati’l khayr wa a‘ūdhu bika min fujā’atish-sharr

21.wird: اللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ رَبِّي لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ خَلَقْتَنِي، وَأَنَا عَبْدُكَ وَأَنَا عَلَى عَهْدِكَ وَوَعْدِكَ مَا اسْتَطَعْتُ، أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا صَنَعْتُ، أَبُوءُ لَكَ بِنِعْمَتِكَ عَلَيَّ، وَأَبُوءُ بِذَنْبِي فَاغْفِرْ لِي فَإِنَّهُ لَا يَغْفِرُ الذُّنُوبَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ.
21.english: O my Beloved Lord, You are my Caretaker, the One Who looks after me fully and completely! There is no one worthy of being sought but You. You have created me, and I am Yours. I commit to my promise and covenant to You, to the maximum of my ability! I seek refuge in You from the evil of that which I have brought about through my actions! I come to You, fully acknowledging Your great favors upon me! And I come to You acknowledging my sins - forgive me! For no one can forgive but You!
21.transliteration: Allāhumma Anta Rabbī, lā ilāha illā Anta, khalaqtanī wa anā ‘abduka wa anā ‘alā ‘ahdika wa wa‘dika ma’stata‘tu, a‘ūdhu bika min sharri mā sana‘tu, abū’u laka bi ni‘matika ‘alayya, wa abū’u bi dhanbī fa’ghfir lī fa innahū lā yaghfiru’dh-dhunūba illā Anta

22.wird: اللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ رَبِّي لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ عَلَيْكَ تَوَكَّلْتُ وَأَنْتَ رَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيمِ مَا شَاءَ اللَّهُ كَانَ وَمَا لَمْ يَشَأْ لَمْ يَكُنْ لَا حَوْلَ وَلَا قُوَّةَ إِلَّا بِاللَّهِ الْعَلِيِّ الْعَظِيمِ أَعْلَمُ أَنَّ اللَّهَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ قَدْ أَحَاطَ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عِلْمًا اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ نَفْسِي وَمِنْ شَرِّ كُلِّ دَابَّةٍ أَنْتَ آخِذٌ بِنَاصِيَتِهَا إِنَّ رَبِّي عَلَى صِرَاطٍ مُسْتَقِيمٍ.
22.english: O my Lord, You are my Caretaker, there is no god but You. Upon You, I rely completely, and You are the Lord of the Great Throne. Whatever Allah wills happens, and whatever He does not will, does not happen. There is no power or strength except with Allah, the Most High, the Most Great. I know that Allah is Able to do all things, and that Allah has encompassed all things in knowledge. O my Lord, I seek refuge in You from the evil of my own self, and from the evil of every creature You hold by the forelock. Indeed, my Lord is on a Straight Path.
22.transliteration: Allāhumma Anta Rabbī lā ilāha illā Anta ‘alayka tawakkaltu wa Anta Rabbu’l ‘Arshi’l ‘Azīm Mā shā’a Allāhu kāna wa mā lam yasha’ lam yakun la hawla wa lā quwwata illā Billāhi’l ‘Aliyyi’l ‘Azīm A‘lamu Annallāha ‘alā kulli shay’in Qadīr wa Annallāha qad ahāta bi kulli shay’in ‘ilmā Allāhumma innī a‘ūdhu bika min sharri nafsī wa min sharri kulli dābbatin Anta ākhidhun bi nāsiyatihā inna Rabbī ‘alā Sirātin Mustaqīm

23.wird: يَا حَيُّ يَا قَيُّومُ بِرَحْمَتِكَ أَسْتَغِيثُ، أَصْلِحْ لِي شَأْنِي كُلَّهُ، وَلَا تَكِلْنِي إِلَى نَفْسِي طَرْفَةَ عَيْنٍ.
23.english: The Ever-Living, the Self-Subsisting (by Whom all subsist). I seek help through Your Mercy and protection from Your Punishment. Set right all my affairs, and do not leave me to myself or to anyone from Your creation, even for the blink of an eye.
23.transliteration: Yā Hayyu Yā Qayyūm bi Rahmatika astaghīth wa min ‘adhābika astajīr aslih lī sha’nī kullahū wa lā takilnī ilā nafsī wa lā ilā ahadin min khalqika tarfata ‘ayn

24.wird: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْهَمِّ وَالْحَزَنِ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْعَجْزِ وَالْكَسَلِ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْجُبْنِ وَالْبُخْلِ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ غَلَبَةِ الدَّيْنِ وَقَهْرِ الرِّجَالِ.
24.english: O my Lord, I come to You seeking Your refuge from suffering anxiety or sadness, and from being afflicted by incapacity or laziness, and from feeling cowardice or miserliness, and from facing overwhelming debt or the oppression of people.
24.transliteration: Allāhumma innī a‘ūdhu bika mina’l hammi wa’l hazan wa a‘ūdhu bika mina’l-‘ajzi wa’l kasal wa a‘ūdhu bika minal jubni wa’l bukhl wa a‘ūdhu bika min ghalabati’d dayn wa qahri’r-rijāl

25.wird: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ الْعَافِيَةَ فِي الدُّنْيَا وَالآخِرَةِ.
25.english: O Allāh, I beg of You to keep me safe and sound in this life and the next.
25.transliteration: Allāhumma innī as’aluka’l ‘āfiyata fi’d-dunyā wa’l ākhirah

26.wird: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ الْعَفْوَ وَالْعَافِيَةَ وَالْمَعَافَاةَ الدَّائِمَةَ فِي دِينِي وَدُنْيَايَ وَأَهْلِي وَمَالِي.
26.english: O Allāh! I ask You safety, security and permanent protection in relation to my religion, worldly affairs, family and property.
26.transliteration: Allāhumma innī as’aluka’l ‘afwa wa’l ‘āfiyata wa’l mu‘āfāta’d-dā’imata fī dīnī wa dunyāya wa ahlī wa mālī

27.english: O Allāh! Please hide my mistakes and weaknesses and make me feel safe and secure.

28.wird: اللَّهُمَّ، اِحْفَظْنِي مِنْ بَيْنِ يَدَيْ وَمِنْ خَلْفِي وَعَنْ يَمِينِي وَعَنْ شِمَالِي وَمِنْ فَوْقِي، وَأَعُوذُ بِعَظَمَتِكَ أَنْ أَغْتَالَ مِنْ تَحْتِي.
28.english: O Allāh! Protect me from the front, the rear, the right, the left and from above; I seek refuge in Your Magnificence, in the event that I may suddenly be destroyed from beneath.
28.transliteration: Allāhummahfaznī min bayni yadayya wa min khalfī wa ‘an yamīnī wa ‘an shimālī wa min fawqī wa a‘ūdhu bi ‘azamatika an ughtāla min tahtī

29.wird: اللَّهُمَّ، أَنْتَ خَلَقْتَنِي وَأَنْتَ تَهْدِينِي وَأَنْتَ تُطْعِمُنِي وَأَنْتَ تَسْقِينِي وَأَنْتَ تُمِيتُنِي وَأَنْتَ تُحْيِينِي، وَأَنْتَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ.
29.english: O my Lord, it is You Who created me and You Who guides me, You Who feeds me, and You Who gives me to drink! You cause me to die, and You bring me back to life! And You are Able to do anything, You have Complete Power.
29.transliteration: Allāhumma Anta khalaqtanī, wa Anta tahdīnī, wa Anta tut‘imunī, wa Anta tasqīnī, wa Anta tumītunī, wa Anta tuhyīnī, wa Anta ‘ala kulli shayin qadeer

30.wird: أَصْبَحْنَا عَلَى فِطْرَةِ الْإِسْلَامِ، وَعَلَى كَلِمَةِ الْإِخْلَاصِ، وَعَلَى دِينِ نَبِيِّنَا مُحَمَّدٍ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِهِ وَسَلَّمَ، وَعَلَى مِلَّةِ أَبِينَا إِبْرَاهِيمَ حَنِيفًا مُسْلِمًا، وَمَا كَانَ مِنَ الْمُشْرِكِينَ.
30.english: We enter this morning with the natural purity of Islām, with the Words of Sincerity, with the religion of our Prophet Muḥammad (Blessings and Peace be upon him and his family) and in accordance with the faith of our father Ibrāhīm, who was by nature an upright Muslim; and he was not from the idolaters.
30.eveningwird: أَمْسَيْنَا عَلَى فِطْرَةِ الْإِسْلَامِ، وَعَلَى كَلِمَةِ الْإِخْلَاصِ، وَعَلَى دِينِ نَبِيِّنَا مُحَمَّدٍ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِهِ وَسَلَّمَ، وَعَلَى مِلَّةِ أَبِينَا إِبْرَاهِيمَ حَنِيفًا مُسْلِمًا، وَمَا كَانَ مِنَ الْمُشْرِكِينَ.
30.transliteration: Asbahnā ‘alā fitrati’l Islām, wa ‘alā Kalimati’l Ikhlās, wa ‘alā dīni Nabiyyinā Muhammad-in, Sallallāhu ‘alayhi wa ālihi wa sallam, wa ‘alā millati abīnā Ibrāhīma, Hanīfan Musliman wa mā kāna min al-mushrikīn

31.wird: اللَّهُمَّ بِكَ أَصْبَحْنَا، وَبِكَ أَمْسَيْنَا، وَبِكَ نَحْيَا، وَبِكَ نَمُوتُ، وَعَلَيْكَ نَتَوَكَّلُ، وَإِلَيْكَ النُّشُورُ.
31.english: In the morning:O my Lord,by You we have awoken to this day,and by You we will retire into its night.By You we live, and by You we die.We place our complete reliance upon You.And to You we will be resurrected.In the evening:O my Lord,by You we retire into this night,and by You we awaken to this day.By You we live, and by You we die.We place our complete reliance upon You.And our destiny is to return to You.
31.eveningwird: اللَّهُمَّ بِكَ أَمْسَيْنَا، وَبِكَ أَصْبَحْنَا، وَبِكَ نَحْيَا، وَبِكَ نَمُوتُ، وَعَلَيْكَ نَتَوَكَّلُ، وَإِلَيْكَ النُّشُورُ
31.transliteration: Allāhumma bika asbahnā, wa bika amsaynā, wa bika nahyā wa bika namūtu, wa ilayka natawakkalu, wa ilayka n-nushūr.

32.wird: أَصْبَحْنَا وَأَصْبَحَ الْمُلْكُ لِلَّهِ، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ.
32.english: We, and the entire Kingdom of Allāh have risen this morning, purely for the sake of Allāh; and all Praise be to Allāh, Lord of the Worlds
32.eveningwird: أَمْسَيْنَا وَأَمْسَى الْمُلْكُ لِلَّهِ، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
32.transliteration: Asbahnā wa asbaha’l mulku Lillāhi, wa’l hamdu Lillāhi Rabbi’l ‘ālamīn.

33.wird: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَ هَذَا الْيَوْمِ: فَتْحَهُ، وَنَصْرَهُ، وَنُورَهُ، وَبَرَكَتَهُ، وَهُدَاهُ
33.english: O Allāh! I ask of You the best of this day, its openings, its help, its light, its blessings and its guidance
33.eveningwird: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَ هَذَا اللَّيْلِ: فَتْحَهُ، وَنَصْرَهُ، وَنُورَهُ، وَبَرَكَتَهُ، وَهُدَاهُ
33.transliteration: Allāhumma innī as’aluka khayra hādha’l yawm fathahū wa nasrahū wa nūrahū wa barakatahū wa hudāh.

34.wird: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَ هَذَا الْيَوْمِ وَخَيْرَ مَا قَبْلَهُ وَخَيْرَ مَا بَعْدَهُ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ هَذَا الْيَوْمِ وَشَرِّ مَا بَعْدَهُ.
34.english: O Allāh! I ask of You the goodness of this day, the best of what is in it, and the best of what is before it; and the best of that which is after it; and I seek Your protection against the evil of this day, the evil that is in it, and the evil of that which is before it, and the evil of that which is after it.
34.eveningwird: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَ هَذَهِ اللَّيْلَةِ وَخَيْرَ مَا قَبْلَهَا وَخَيْرَ مَا بَعْدَهَا، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ هَذَهِ اللَّيْلَةِ وَشَرِّ مَا بَعْدَهَا
34.transliteration: Allāhumma innī as’aluka khayra hādha’l yawm wa khayra mā qablahū wa khayra mā ba‘dahū wa a‘ūdhu bika min sharri hādha’l yawm wa sharri mā ba‘dahū

35.wird: اللَّهُمَّ مَا أَصْبَحَ بِي مِنْ نِعْمَةٍ أَوْ بِأَحَدٍ مِنْ خَلْقِكَ فَمِنْكَ وَحْدَكَ، لَا شَرِيكَ لَكَ، فَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ وَلَكَ الشُّكْرُ عَلَى ذَلِكَ.
35.english: O Allah! Any blessing that has reached me or any of Your creation this morning is from You alone. You have no partner. Praise and thanks are due to You.
35.eveningwird: اللَّهُمَّ مَا أَمْسَى بِي مِنْ نِعْمَةٍ أَوْ بِأَحَدٍ مِنْ خَلْقِكَ فَمِنْكَ وَحْدَكَ، لَا شَرِيكَ لَكَ، فَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ وَلَكَ الشُّكْرُ عَلَى ذَلِكَ
35.transliteration: Allāhumma mā asbaha bi min ni‘matin aw bi-ahadin min khalqika fa-minka wa h daka, lā sharīka laka, fa-laka’l hamdu wa-laka’sh shukru ‘alā dhalik.

36.wird: سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ، عَدَدَ خَلْقِهِ وَرِضَا نَفْسِهِ، وَزِنَةَ عَرْشِهِ، وَمِدَادَ كَلِمَاتِهِ.
36.english: “Glory be to God and praise be unto Him” As many times as is equal to the quantity of all that He has created And to the measure of His Pleasure And to the weight of the entire cosmos And to the ink of His Words!
36.transliteration: Subḥāna Allāhi wa biḥamdihi, ‘adada khalqihi wa riḍā nafsihi, wa zinata ‘arshihi, wa midāda kalimātihi.

37.wird: سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ الْعَظِيمِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ، عَدَدَ خَلْقِهِ وَرِضَا نَفْسِهِ، وَزِنَةَ عَرْشِهِ، وَمِدَادَ كَلِمَاتِهِ.
37.english: Glory and Praise be to Allāh, equal to the number of His creation, to the degree that pleases Him, to the weight of His Throne, and the ink of the meaning of His Eternal Words.
37.transliteration: Subḥāna Allāhi’l ‘Aẓīm wa biḥamdihi, ‘adada khalqihi wa riḍā nafsihi, wa zinata ‘arshihi, wa midāda kalimātihi.

38.wird: سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ عَدَدَ مَا خَلَقَ فِي السَّمَاءِ، سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ عَدَدَ مَا خَلَقَ فِي الْأَرْضِ، سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ عَدَدَ مَا بَيْنَ ذَلِكَ، سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ عَدَدَ مَا هُوَ خَالِقٌ.
38.english: Glory be to Allāh, equal to the number of His creation in the Heavens; Glory be to Allāh, equal to the number of His creation on earth; Glory be to Allāh, equal to the number of His creation between them; Glory be to Allāh, equal to the number of Him being the Creator.
38.transliteration: Subḥāna Allāhi ‘adada mā khalaqa fī’s-samāi, Subḥāna Allāhi ‘adada mā khalaqa fī’l arḍi, Subḥāna Allāhi ‘adada mā bayna dhalika, Subḥāna Allāhi ‘adada mā huwa khāliqun.

39.wird: الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ عَدَدَ مَا خَلَقَ فِي السَّمَاءِ، الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ عَدَدَ مَا خَلَقَ فِي الْأَرْضِ، الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ عَدَدَ مَا بَيْنَ ذَلِكَ، الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ عَدَدَ مَا هُوَ خَالِقٌ.
39.english: All Praise be to Allāh, equal to the number of His creation in the Heavens; All Praise be to Allāh, equal to the number of His creation on earth; All Praise be to Allāh, equal to the number of His creation between them; All Praise be to Allāh, equal to the number of Him being the Creator
39.transliteration: Al-ḥamdu Lillāhi ‘adada mā khalaqa fī’s-samāi, Al-ḥamdu Lillāhi ‘adada mā khalaqa fī’l arḍi, Al-ḥamdu Lillāhi ‘adada mā bayna dhalika, Al-ḥamdu Lillāhi ‘adada mā huwa khāliqun.

40.wird: لا إِلَٰهَ إِلاَّ اللَّٰهُ عَدَدَ مَا خَلَقَ فِي السَّمَاءِ، لا إِلَٰهَ إِلاَّ اللَّٰهُ عَدَدَ مَا خَلَقَ فِي الْأَرْضِ، لا إِلَٰهَ إِلاَّ اللَّٰهُ عَدَدَ مَا بَيْنَ ذَلِكَ، لا إِلَٰهَ إِلاَّ اللَّٰهُ عَدَدَ مَا هُوَ خَالِقٌ.
40.english: There is no god, but Allāh, equal to the number of His creation in the Heavens; There is no god, but Allāh, equal to the number of His creation on earth; There is no god, but Allāh, equal to the number of His creation between them; There is no god, but Allāh, equal to the number of Him being the Creator
40.transliteration: Lā ilāha illā Allāhu ‘adada mā khalaqa fī’s-samā’i, lā ilāha illā Allāhu ‘adada mā khalaqa fī’l arḍi, lā ilāha illā Allāhu ‘adada mā bayna dhalika, lā ilāha illā Allāhu ‘adada mā huwa khāliqun.

41.wird: اللهُ أَكْبَرُ عَدَدُ مَا خَلَقَ فِي السَّمَاءِ، اللهُ أَكْبَرُ عَدَدُ مَا خَلَقَ فِي الْأَرْضِ، اللهُ أَكْبَرُ عَدَدُ مَا بَيْنَ ذَلِكَ، اللهُ أَكْبَرُ عَدَدُ مَا هُوَ خَالِقٌ.
41.english: Allāh is the Greatest, equal to the number of His creation in the Heavens; Allāh is the Greatest, equal to the number of His creation on earth; Allāh is the Greatest, equal to the number of His creation between them; Allāh is the Greatest, equal to the number of Him being the Creator.
41.transliteration: Allāhu akbaru ‘adada mā khalaqa fī’s-samā’i, Allāhu akbaru ‘adada mā khalaqa fī’l arḍi, Allāhu akbaru ‘adada mā bayna dhalika, Allāhu akbaru ‘adada mā huwa khāliqun.

42.wird: لاَ حَوْلَ وَلاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللَّهِ الْعَلِيِّ الْعَظِيْمِ، عَدَدَ مَا خَلَقَ فِي السَّمَاءِ، وَلاَ حَوْلَ وَلاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللَّهِ الْعَلِيِّ الْعَظِيْمِ، عَدَدَ مَا خَلَقَ فِي الأَرْضِ، وَلاَ حَوْلَ وَلاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللَّهِ الْعَلِيِّ الْعَظِيْمِ، عَدَدَ مَا بَيْنَ ذَلِكَ، وَلاَ حَوْلَ وَلاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللَّهِ الْعَلِيِّ الْعَظِيْمِ، عَدَدَ مَا هُوَ خَالِقٌ
42.english: There is no Power nor Strength except with Allāh the Exalted, the Mighty, equal to the number of His creation in the Heavens; There is no Power nor Strength except with Allāh the Exalted, the Mighty, equal to the number of His creation on earth; There is no Power nor Strength except with Allāh the Exalted, the Mighty, equal to the number His creation between them (Heaven and earth); There is no Power nor Strength except with Allāh the Exalted, the Mighty, equal to the number of Him being the Creator
42.transliteration: Lā ḥawla wa lā quwwata illā bi’llāhi’l ‘Aliyyi’l ‘Aẓīm, ‘adada mā khalaqa fī’s-samā’i, wa lā ḥawla wa lā quwwata illā bi’llāhi’l ‘Aliyyi’l ‘Aẓīm, ‘adada mā khalaqa fī’l arḍi, wa lā ḥawla wa lā quwwata illā bi’llāhi’l ‘Aliyyi’l ‘Aẓīm, ‘adada mā bayna dhalika, wa lā ḥawla wa lā quwwata illā bi’llāhi’l ‘Aliyyi’l ‘Aẓīm, ‘adada mā huwa khāliqun.

43.wird: لا إلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ يُحْيِي وَيُمِيتُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ، عَدَدَ دُ كُلِّ ذَرَّةٍ أَلْفَ مَرَّةٍ.
43.english: There is no one to be sought but God, the One God, Who has no partner.He is the Only One Who has power over all things,and every single aspect of creation lies in His Hands,belonging utterly to Him and no one else.To God all praise is given,the One Who gives life, and the One Who brings death.He has the Power to do anything,Nothing is beyond His Ability!May this affirmation of mine be multiplied by the number of every atom in existence,a thousand times over!
43.transliteration: Lā ilāha illā Allāhu waḥdahu lā sharīka lahū, lahū’l mulku wa lahū’l ḥamdu yuḥyī wa yumītu wa huwa ‘alā kulli shay’in qadīrun, ‘adada dū kulli dharra’in alfa marra’in.

44.wird: اللَّهُمَّ صَلِّ وَسَلِّمْ عَلَى سَيِّدِنَا مُحَمَّدٍ مَفْتَاحِ بَابِ رَحْمَةِ اللَّهِ عَدَدَ مَا فِي عِلْمِ اللَّهِ، صَلَاةً وَسَلَامًا دَائِمِيْنَ بِدَوَامِ مُلْكِ اللَّهِ، وَعَلَى آلِهِ وَصَحْبِهِ، عَدَدَ كُلِّ ذَرَّةٍ أَلْفَ مَرَّةٍ.
44.english: O Allāh! Send Peace and Salutations upon our master Muḥammad, the key to the Door of Your Mercy, equal to the number of Your Knowledge; an Everlasting Peace and Salutation in Your Everlasting Dominion, is showered upon his family and Companions; equal to the number of every atom a thousand times
44.transliteration: Allāhumma ṣalli wa sallim ‘alā sayyidinā Muḥammadin miftāḥi bābi raḥmati’llāhi ‘adada mā fī ‘ilmi’llāhi, ṣalātan wa salāman dā’imayni bi-dawāmi mulki’llāhi, wa ‘alā ālihi wa ṣaḥbihi, ‘adada kulli dharra’in alfa marra’in.
